image.altText: Warren Tredrea walks outside court.

props.synopsis: A court orders ex-footballer and sports presenter Warren Tredrea to pay $149,000 to cover legal costs that were accumulated by his former employer, Channel Nine, during part of the long-running court battle between the parties.

title.children: Tredrea ordered to pay $149k for Channel Nine's legal costs

image.altText: A serious Matthew Nicks talks to his players during a break in a game. He is bald and is wearing a multi-coloured tee.

props.synopsis: Adelaide fans are threatening to cancel their memberships after a Collingwood star was targeted during the AFL qualifying final.

title.children: 'I felt ashamed': Crows fans hit out at homophobic slurs during QF

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed the missing remains found by a member of the public in scrubland east of Port Lincoln are that of alleged murder victim Julian Story. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Testing confirms alleged murder victim's remains, police say

image.altText: A woman holding a pregnancy test.

props.synopsis: A renewed push to change South Australia's pregnancy termination laws is set to be introduced to the state's parliament, with an independent MP proposing to place significant new restrictions on abortion access.

title.children: New push to change South Australian abortion laws

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal women stand and sit around a large painting in the desert.

props.synopsis: Smithy Zimran died before he could realise his dream of receiving dialysis on country, but his legacy lives on.

title.children: Remote community celebrates anniversary of dialysis breakthrough

image.altText: Education Minister Blair Boyer talking to a reporter

props.synopsis: South Australia's Education Minister believes there is more work to be done to boost safeguards within the childcare sector. He says well-trained staff would be the key to preventing "shocking things happening to kids".

title.children: SA education minister says childcare staff key to preventing ‘shocking’ incidents

image.altText: GettyImages-2232975247

props.synopsis: Magpies player Isaac Quaynor says he tried to block out the noise after Crows fans booed him during their qualifying final clash.

title.children: Crows coach deflects questions about fans booing Pies slur victim

image.altText: A cartoon character screenshot from the video game hollow knight silksong

props.synopsis: After years of silence, Team Cherry has released their sequel to one of the most successful Australian-made games of all time, which is expected to break records.

title.children: Australian-made Hollow Knight: Silksong crashes global stores on launch

image.altText: Smoke about the Lucindale grass fire

props.synopsis: A judge finds that vegetation heaps lit on fire by grazier Tom Brinkworth burned for six months before causing a bushfire that destroyed three houses.

title.children: Supreme Court rules late pastoralist's actions led to SA bushfire

image.altText: People in suit jackets outside court.

props.synopsis: Prominent Melbourne property investor Adrian Portelli pleads not guilty in an Adelaide court to 19 charges relating to allegations he was running "unlawful lotteries in South Australia".

title.children: Adrian Portelli blames illegal lotteries trial on 'big miscommunication'

image.altText: A middle-aged man with a light, grey beard wears high-vis as he holds leaves hanging from a tree in his hands.

props.synopsis: Producers and beekeepers had been expecting the arrival of the parasite. Now they are bracing for impact.

title.children: Uncertainty for SA communities after first varroa mite detection

image.altText: composite image of Vincent Tarzia on a stage, Troy Bell outdoors

props.synopsis: With the departure of Troy Bell this week, the South Australian Liberal Party had its sights set on finally winning a by-election. Instead, they were reminded of their 28-year political nightmare.

title.children: Mad Monday beers, a UK theatre fan and a 28-year Liberal Party nightmare

image.altText: Troy Bell looks serious while being filmed in camera

props.synopsis: Former South Australian MP Troy Bell, who was previously found guilty of serious fraud charges, is also facing a raft of deception allegations, it can be revealed.

title.children: Former SA MP charged over alleged misuse of accommodation allowance

image.altText: Honeybees on a frame, beekeeper points a finger at the queen bee.

props.synopsis: The "world's worst" honey bee parasite, varroa mite, has been detected in South Australia for the first time. Now in five jurisdictions across Australia, what impact will it have on the agricultural industry?

title.children: A honey bee-killing parasite is in SA for the first time. What impact will it have?

image.altText: Ollie Dempsey celebrates a goal with his teammates

props.synopsis: Geelong responds brilliantly in the second half after a number of dubious umpiring calls threatened to stop their momentum dead in its tracks before half-time. Follow live.

title.children: Geelong shrugs off umpire's 'disgraceful' double-free kick to advance to preliminary final

image.altText: Cartons of eggs on a supermarket shelf.

props.synopsis: Coles says the cost of living and supply chain disruptions are behind its decision to continue selling caged eggs until 2030. A consumer expert says it is likely the supermarket's competitors will follow suit.

title.children: Coles abandons plan to stop selling caged eggs by end of year

image.altText: A soccer player in yellow celebrates a goal in front of two players in white

props.synopsis: Central midfielder Max Balard scores two minutes into his international debut as the Socceroos defeat New Zealand 1-0 in the first leg of the Soccer Ashes in Canberra. Follow live.

title.children: Debut goal earns disjointed Socceroos victory over New Zealand

image.altText: Tina bends her knees and appears to sing or scream upwards, her fists clenched, in the black and white photograph.

props.synopsis: The new portrait comes in two parts — known as a diptych — and will be on display at the National Portrait Gallery from September 6 to mark Tina Arena's 50-year career.

title.children: Portrait of Tina Arena unveiled to mark 50-year music career

image.altText: A man in his 30s is speaking while holding a mic

props.synopsis: Gary Stevenson achieved his childhood dream of becoming rich by his mid-20s. The 39-year-old now spends most of his time campaigning against the wealthy.

title.children: The rich are 'squeezing out' ordinary people and this millionaire aims to stop it

image.altText: A street sign that says Broughton Street

props.synopsis: Police praised bystanders for saving a 17-year-old girl being attacked by a large mixed-breed dog in the New South Wales Hunter Valley.

title.children: Police praise bystanders for helping girl attacked by dog

image.altText: A big white iceberg hangs into the sea

props.synopsis: A colossal iceberg ranked among the oldest and largest ever recorded is crumbling apart in warm Antarctic waters, and could disappear within weeks.

title.children: One of the biggest icebergs ever seen could be 'gone in weeks'

image.altText: A woman celebrates after winning a pole vault competition

props.synopsis: World and Olympic champion pole vaulter Nina Kennedy has had her hopes of defending her title at the World Athletics Championships dashed, with the Australian forced to pull out with injury.

title.children: Pole vault champion Nina Kennedy pulls out of World Athletics Championships

image.altText: A reddish full moon.

props.synopsis: A total lunar eclipse, also known as a "blood moon", will be visible across all of Australia next week. Here's what you need to know to get the best view and snap the best photo.

title.children: Australia is about to get our only total lunar eclipse for 2025

image.altText: Belarusian tennis star Aryna Sabalenka throws her head back and roars in celebration after winning a match.

props.synopsis: Women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka is one win from defending her US Open title as she beats American star Jessica Pegula in a rematch of last year's final.

title.children: Sabalenka beats hometown heroine Pegula to reach US Open final

image.altText: A generic image of a child stands before a woman holding the scales of justice and a sword

props.synopsis: The victim of the first inmate to be granted assisted dying in NSW has criticised the decision, claiming victims should be considered.

title.children: Victim demands to be 'considered' as abuser granted assisted dying

image.altText: Bec Haight

props.synopsis: Women without partners, or in same-sex relationships, had to pay thousands of dollars for at least two rounds of fertility procedures before they could access rebates.

title.children: 'Socially infertile' women in class action over 'unfair' policy

image.altText: female couple kissing in the kitchen

props.synopsis: We hear a lot about spring cleaning at this time of year, but it's not only your home or wardrobe that might need a refresh.

title.children: 'Spring cleaning' a relationship can help partners reconnect

image.altText: Diane Keaton (centre) in a grey suit jacket and checked scarf holding an oscar, surrounded by men in suits.

props.synopsis: Giorgio Armani's name has become synonymous with the red carpet, thanks to his close relationship with the stars.

title.children: Diane Keaton's jacket started a love affair between Armani and the stars

image.altText: Red blue and white sign in front of a tall building and car park.

props.synopsis: KBS died in 2019 from a ruptured spleen caused by blunt force trauma. A coronial inquest into his death has recommended his death be investigated by police.

title.children: Toddler's death to be referred to unsolved homicide squad

image.altText: A person wearing medical gloves draws a vaccine from a bottle with a syringe

props.synopsis: Congo has 28 suspected cases of Ebola, but the World Health Organization expects that number to increase.

title.children: Congo declares another Ebola outbreak after 15 deaths

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The prime minister says the pair had a "warm and constructive" conversation about trade, critical minerals and shared security interests.

title.children: PM says he had 'warm and constructive' conversation with Trump

image.altText: Trish Gyler cleans her teeth

props.synopsis: A creditor’s report into Supercare Dental and Cosmetics Tuggerah reveals almost $3 million in unsecured creditor claims with little chance patients will be able to recoup their money.

title.children: Australians left with 'ugly' teeth and no super are unlikely to see their money again

image.altText: Three men in suits walk in a row

props.synopsis: It was another huge week of news. Did you catch it all? Test your memory here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A viral Trump rumour, an ex-politician under fire and de Minaur's bad luck
